host.description: The host name of the database.
host.title: Host

username.description: The username which is used to access the database.
username.title: Username

password.description: The password associated with the username.
password.title: Password

jdbc_url_params.description: Additional properties to pass to the JDBC URL string when connecting to the database formatted as 'key=value' pairs separated by the symbol '&'. (example: key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3). For more information read about JDBC URL parameters.
jdbc_url_params.title: JDBC URL Parameters (Advanced)

ssl_mode.title: SSL modes
ssl_mode.description: SSL connection modes. Read more in the docs.

oneOf.title: preferred
oneOf.description: Automatically attempt SSL connection. If the MySQL server does not support SSL, continue with a regular connection.

oneOf.title: required
oneOf.description: Always connect with SSL. If the MySQL server doesnâ€™t support SSL, the connection will not be established. Certificate Authority (CA) and Hostname are not verified.

oneOf.title: Verify CA
oneOf.description: Always connect with SSL. Verifies CA, but allows connection even if Hostname does not match.

client_certificate.title: Client certificate
client_certificate.description: Client certificate (this is not a required field, but if you want to use it, you will need to add the Client key as well)

client_key.title: Client key
client_key.description: Client key (this is not a required field, but if you want to use it, you will need to add the Client certificate as well)

client_key_password.title: Client key password
client_key_password.description: Password for keystorage. This field is optional. If you do not add it - the password will be generated automatically.

oneOf.title: Verify Identity
oneOf.description: Always connect with SSL. Verify both CA and Hostname.

client_certificate.title: Client certificate
client_certificate.description: Client certificate (this is not a required field, but if you want to use it, you will need to add the Client key as well)

client_key.title: Client key
client_key.description: Client key (this is not a required field, but if you want to use it, you will need to add the Client certificate as well)

client_key_password.title: Client key password
client_key_password.description: Password for keystorage. This field is optional. If you do not add it - the password will be generated automatically.

replication_method.title: Replication Method
replication_method.description: Replication method to use for extracting data from the database.

oneOf.title: Standard
oneOf.description: Standard replication requires no setup on the DB side but will not be able to represent deletions incrementally.

oneOf.title: Logical Replication (CDC)
oneOf.description: CDC uses the Binlog to detect inserts, updates, and deletes. This needs to be configured on the source database itself.

initial_waiting_seconds.title: Initial Waiting Time in Seconds (Advanced)
initial_waiting_seconds.description: The amount of time the connector will wait when it launches to determine if there is new data to sync or not. Defaults to 300 seconds. Valid range: 120 seconds to 1200 seconds. Read about initial waiting time.

server_time_zone.title: Configured server timezone for the MySQL source (Advanced)
server_time_zone.description: Enter the configured MySQL server timezone. This should only be done if the configured timezone in your MySQL instance does not conform to IANNA standard.
